meta.title: Aether Nexus Vendetta: Thorne's Last Byte
meta.intro_text: Welcome to Aether Nexus, 2099. A gleaming corporate citadel orbiting Earth, where humanity's elite conduct business, research, and recreation. But even in this beacon of progress, darkness can lurk. Elias Thorne, the ruthless CEO of OmniCorp Data Solutions and a titan of the infotech world, has been found dead in his lavish private sky-lounge. His personal AI discovered him at 23:15, unresponsive. Forensics indicate he succumbed to a lethal neuro-toxin, 'Synaptic Shadow', administered via his customized neural implant. The station's security is on lockdown, and it's up to you to uncover the truth behind Thorne's demise. Three individuals on board had strong reasons to wish Thorne gone, but only one is a murderer.

solution.motive: Dr. Kaelen Varr orchestrated the murder of Elias Thorne as revenge. Thorne had stolen Varr's groundbreaking research on neural implants and the 'Synaptic Shadow' neuro-toxin concept, then absorbed and dismantled Varr's company, CogniMind. Varr's motive was solidified when he learned Thorne was planning to sell the stolen, dangerous research. Varr, an expert in neural technology, remotely hacked Thorne's custom implant during a brief window when he left his lab, delivering the toxin.

outcomes.success: The truth has been uncovered. Dr. Kaelen Varr is apprehended, his meticulous plan unravelled by your keen investigation. Justice is served, even on the fringes of the known galaxy.
outcomes.failure: Your accusation missed the mark. The true killer walks free, and Aether Nexus descends into further uncertainty. The station's reputation is irrevocably stained, and a dangerous criminal remains at large.
outcomes.timeout: Time has run out. The trail has gone cold, and crucial evidence may have been compromised. The murder of Elias Thorne remains unsolved, a chilling reminder of the perils even in the most advanced frontiers.

suspects.name: Dr. Kaelen Varr
suspects.bio: A brilliant but disgraced cyber-neurologist, once the lead innovator at 'CogniMind', a rival corporation that Elias Thorne aggressively acquired and dismantled. Dr. Varr's career and reputation were utterly destroyed in the process.
knowledge_sentences: I was in my private lab in the Bio-Engineering Sector from 20:00 until after midnight, working on my neural network simulations.
Elias Thorne destroyed my life and stole my research; he deserved whatever came to him, but I'm not a killer.
I saw Commander Rourke near the central comms hub around 19:30, looking stressed, probably about some security breach.
Thorne's customized neural implant was based on my own early designs, a sophisticated piece of tech, very hard to bypass.
I heard rumors Thorne was having issues with a data broker, Lena Volkov, over a big contract, something about exposure.
The 'Synaptic Shadow' neuro-toxin? I conceptualized a similar agent years ago, but it was purely theoretical, too dangerous to synthesize.
I briefly saw Thorne in the Sky-Lounge foyer around 19:00, he looked like he'd just finished a tense meeting with someone.
My lab's network logs will show I was engaged in heavy processing, nothing suspicious or out of the ordinary.
I only left my lab once, for a few minutes, to grab a synth-coffee from the dispenser down the hall around 22:15. Didn't see anyone there.

timeline.19:00: Briefly in Sky-Lounge foyer, then returned to lab.
timeline.20:00: In private lab, working on simulations.
timeline.21:00: In private lab, working on simulations.
timeline.22:00: In private lab, working on simulations (left for coffee at 22:15).
timeline.23:00: Returned to private lab, continued work.

suspects.defense_statement: Preposterous! I've been smeared by Thorne for years, but I am a man of science, not a murderer. My work keeps me isolated. Check my data, it will prove my innocence.
suspects.fallback_statement: My apologies, I am focused on my research. I cannot provide information on that particular subject.

suspects.name: Commander Jax Rourke
suspects.bio: Chief of Security for Aether Nexus. An ex-military hardliner, Commander Rourke frequently clashed with Thorne over the CEO's lax security practices and attempts to bypass station protocols.
knowledge_sentences: My patrol logs show I was in Sector Delta-7, near the Bio-Engineering Sector entrance, from 22:00 to 23:00, monitoring activity.
I saw Thorne enter his Sky-Lounge around 22:00. He seemed agitated, as if expecting trouble, but didn't say anything to me.
Dr. Varr's lab is in Bio-Engineering. I saw him briefly at the automated coffee dispenser around 22:20. He looked preoccupied, didn't notice me.
Thorne was always trying to cut corners on security. He installed his own custom neural implant, bypassing station protocols and making it a vulnerability.
I had a tense conversation with Lena Volkov in the station's central plaza around 19:45, she was upset about Thorne not paying her for a job.
The Sky-Lounge's private network is isolated, but any hack would likely need a high-gain connection or deep system access from within the station.
I know for a fact Dr. Varr had his entire company, CogniMind, absorbed by OmniCorp. He has a serious grudge against Thorne, everyone knows that.
Around 21:00, I checked the security feed for the main concourse; Lena Volkov was still there, arguing with someone I couldn't identify, looked like a client.

timeline.21:00: Reviewing security feeds in office, then continued patrol.
timeline.23:00: Reported to Sky-Lounge upon discovery of Thorne's body.

suspects.defense_statement: My duty is to this station's security, not to murder its VIPs. My movements are logged, and my hands are clean.
suspects.fallback_statement: That information is classified, or I do not have a report on that.

suspects.name: Lena 'Ghost' Volkov
suspects.bio: A notorious data broker and information-trafficker, Lena was often hired by Thorne for morally dubious tasks. Recently, they had a major falling out over an unpaid contract and Thorne's threats to expose her vast network.
knowledge_sentences: I had a meeting with a client in the Shadow Market from 21:30 until 23:00. No witnesses, that's how I operate.
Thorne owed me a fortune, and he threatened to expose my network if I pressed him. I wanted to see him rot, not dead, not yet.
I had a nasty holo-call with Thorne around 21:45 from my secure comm-booth in the Shadow Market. He was smug, talking about his 'unhackable tech'.
Dr. Varr? Yeah, I know him. He's still bitter about Thorne stealing his implant tech. He always seemed like the type to hold a serious grudge.
I saw Commander Rourke acting shifty near the Bio-Engineering Sector entrance around 20:30. He seemed to be looking for someone or something specific.
Thorne was showing off a new security upgrade for his neural implant, something Varr designed originally, but Thorne 'improved' it. Said it was 'Synaptic Shadow' proof.
My client is anonymous, so I can't provide a name, but I can show my payment transaction logs from the Shadow Market's blockchain at 22:45, verifiable.
I heard Thorne was planning to sell off some of Varr's *stolen* research, the really dangerous stuff, to a rival corp. That would've driven Varr absolutely mad.

timeline.18:00: At my private apartment, Sector Chi-3.
timeline.19:00: Central Plaza, meeting with an informant.
timeline.21:00: In a secure comm-booth in the Shadow Market.
timeline.22:00: Meeting with a client in the Shadow Market.
timeline.23:00: Still with client, then left Shadow Market.

suspects.defense_statement: I'm a data broker, not a killer. Thorne was worth more to me alive, even if he was a pain. My hands are clean, and my network is proof.
suspects.fallback_statement: That information is proprietary, or I simply don't have it.
